TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit TableNotEnabledForNotificationException extends System.SystemException

Docs.summary: The exception that is thrown when a class is used against a database table that is not enabled for change notifications.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example attempts to create a <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency> object and add an item to the <xref:System.Web.Caching.Cache> with a dependency on the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependency> object. If the SQL Server database table is not enabled for dependency notifications, the TableNotEnabledForNotificationException is thrown and handled by calling the <xref:System.Web.Caching.SqlCacheDependencyAdmin.EnableTableForNotifications%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
[!code-vb[CachingSamples_SqlCacheDependency#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.caching.tab_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[CachingSamples_SqlCacheDependency#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.caching.tab_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception innerException) cil managed

Docs.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the `innerException` is not , the current exception is raised in a block that handles the inner exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
